sub_topic: Calculating the volume of a rectangular pyramid.
message_1: A rectangular pyramid has a base area of 36 square cm and a height of 10 cm. What is the volume of the rectangular pyramid?
message_2:
To find the volume of a pyramid, we use the formula:

Volume = (1/3) × Base Area × Height

Given that the base area is 36 square cm and the height is 10 cm, we can plug these values into the formula:

Volume = (1/3) × 36 × 10

Volume = 12 × 10

Volume = 120 cubic cm

So, the volume of the rectangular pyramid is 120 cubic centimeters.
